headerDisplay: Full HomeKit support UniFi Access devices. See the [homebridge-unifi-access](https://github.com/makk1000/homebridge-unifi-access) developer page for detailed documentation.

address.title: Controller Address
address.description: Hostname or IP address of your UniFi Access controller.

mqttTopic.title: MQTT Base Topic
mqttTopic.description: The base MQTT topic to publish to. Default: unifi/access.

mqttUrl.title: MQTT Broker URL
mqttUrl.description: URL for the MQTT broker you'd like to publish event messages to. Default: None.

name.title: Controller Name
name.description: Name for this UniFi Access controller to be used for logging purposes. Default: Defined by the controller.

password.title: Controller Password
password.description: UniFi Access password for this controller. Creating a homebridge-specific local user is strongly encouraged for security and sanity.

username.title: Controller Username
username.description: UniFi Access username for this controller. Creating a homebridge-specific local user is strongly encouraged for security and sanity.

name.title: Plugin Name
name.description: Name to use for Homebridge logging purposes. Default: UniFi Access.

items.title: Feature Option
items.description: Enter only one option per entry. See the plugin documentation for the complete list of available options or use the feature options webUI tab above.

ringDelay.title: Doorbell Ring Delay (seconds)
ringDelay.description: Delay between doorbell rings. Setting this to a non-zero value will prevent multiple rings of a doorbell over the specified duration.  Default: 0.

items.description: Provide the IP address and login details of your UniFi Access controllers.
These settings are optional. The defaults work well for almost everyone.
MQTT support will only be enabled if an MQTT broker URL is specified below.

Feature options allow you to further customize the behavior of this plugin such as the ability to show or hide devices. You can use the the feature options tab above (recommended) to customize these settings or enter them manually below.
These settings should be rarely used or needed by most people. Use these with caution.
